entry.title: The Mirror Divide
entry.summary:
Author: LadyArkin

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,873Chapters: 5/15Kudos: 28

Summary: One ordinary night, Clark Wayne-Kent went to sleep in his bed. The next morning, his husband and children don’t recognize him. He has no baby. Their marriage never happened.Instead of choosing fear, Clark embraces the people that he loves and tries his best to hold his family together. Because they never came together in his new place, Clark never shared Kryptonian technology with Bruce. And the differences in that sequence of events have consequences.

entry.title: “Is There Any More Surprises?”
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,919Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 60

Summary: Damian Wayne thought he knew what he was walking into when his mother dropped him off with Bruce Wayne. A spoiled playboy with too many tabloids under his belt — easy enough to ignore. Instead, he gets a Batcave, two older brothers who don’t stop bickering, and a father who is very much not what he expected.Adjusting to “normal” school life is already a downgrade from his old world, but things only get stranger when he meets a clumsy, soft-hearted boy named Jon Kent… who turns out to be anything but ordinary. Discovering his father is in league with Superman is one thing; realizing Superman’s son keeps crossing his path is another.At sixteen, Damian is just trying to survive his new reality — brothers, secrets, vigilantes, and maybe even a super-powered friendship that could mean more.

entry.title: Every Inch of You
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,503Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 74

Summary: "This is a love story." | "This is a detective story"When Clark Kent follows a story into Gotham, he doesn’t expect to find himself face-to-face with the city’s true guardian: a bat with fangs, claws, and a half-feral silhouette in the shadows. Suspicious, circling him like prey, Batman tests every ounce of Clark’s resolve—only for Clark’s clumsy optimism to slip through anyway (“What the hay, are those fangs?”).Between the silk shawls and champagne smiles of Bruce Wayne, Gotham’s Pretty Boy Playboy, and the smudged-eyeliner hunger of the Bat with Fangs, Clark finds himself drawn to both—the golden boy in the sun and the monster in the dark. He doesn’t break Bruce’s walls with force, but with patience, reverence, and devotion.The monster who refuses to hurt the one he loves, and the hero who would even offer his own blood to keep him alive.

entry.title: Come As You Are
entry.summary:
Author: everyonethinkstoomuch

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 57,401Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 102

Summary: 'Bruce was only watching to see how Clark’s sparring was coming along... He wasn’t watching Clark because he liked him or found him attractive. That would be foolish, and not sensible at all, and a distraction from the more important things in life, like beating up criminals every night and passing his exams.'When Clark Kent gets into yet another fight on a night out, his friend Diana suggests he joins the university boxing club to get used to fighting back, without killing someone with his superpowers. Bruce Wayne has just transferred to Metropolis City University and isn’t all too happy about it. Unlike everyone else he knows, he misses Gotham. And now he has to balance university, being Batman, and his feelings for Clark Kent - which he definitely doesn’t have.CONTENT WARNINGS: a little bit of swearing, implied abuse, implied & described mild violence, lots of discussion of dead parents.This is an AU drawing on several different versions of characters and also my own interpretation of them. Bruce is Battinson, Clark is Corensupes & Smallville. The others are a mix of all media types and kind of just what I want them to be!

entry.summary:

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,132Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 81

Summary: Even at four years old, Tim knew that his family was struggling after the divorce. The darkness that had shadowed over their lives felt as if it would consume them completely.The solution to their problems came to him on his first day of preschool in the form of his 6’4 sunshine personified teacher, Mr. Clark. Maybe there was still hope that everything would get better for the Wayne Family.

entry.title: The Outer Layers
entry.summary:
Author: aerey

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,091Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 40

Summary: Bruce Wayne's life is a perfect, messy struggle. Raising five kids is no easy feat, but with the constant support from his found family (especially Alfred), they've been able to make do. However, Bruce is still, at the end of the day, alone. As CEO of Wayne Enterprises, coming home to an empty bed (except for when one of his kids has a nightmare) after a long day is something he tries not to think about too hard.It all changes when at the beginning of Dick's last and Jason's first year of high school when a new science teacher appears. Clark Kent is like no one Bruce has ever met and has a smile that could light up a dark room. However, as Bruce tries to get to know the man better, the shadows they both carry become evident. Some are old scars smoothed over and some are fresh wounds, waiting to fester and burst.The two are hopeless and awful at communicating, but some things are worth the effort, right?

entry.title: Fear Can Make Us Crack
entry.summary:
Author: PlentyOBombs

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,895Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 9

Summary: Paranoia. The word had been thrown at him more times than he could count. To Bruce, it was never paranoia; it was survival behind a mask. Living in Gotham as long as he had, experiencing as many stabbings as he had heartbreaks, how could anyone not be afraid?Superman had his own kind of paranoia. However, it only surfaced around that space rock, his single weakness, which was now spreading through Gotham like cracks across old stone. Superman's paranoia had found its way to Bruce, seeping into his skin until it became indistinguishable from his own.Superman had his own mask, his own fear, just like Bruce did, and both were simply waiting for who would break first.

entry.title: Sins of the Fathers
entry.summary:
Author: peterpannerisms

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,091Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 18

Summary: “So can I count on you to show him a bit of that good old Smallville charm?”It’s not as though Clark had a valid reason to reject what was so clearly a very generous offer on Perry’s part. Even if he had an excuse, he probably wouldn’t hear the end of it from the other folks at the Planet. Why would Clark turn down such a slam dunk viral news story? Sure, Superman had plenty of reasons to be wary of another rich man flaunting around Metropolis; it hadn’t even been three months since the truth of his Kryptonian mission was revealed to the entire world. Clark had none of the same reservations.“Consider him charmed.”~~~~Or: Clark gets the opportunity to interview Bruce Wayne, who is in town to help fund the reconstruction of Metropolis. Sparks fly...or maybe that's just Bruce Wayne's contact lens camera acting up.

entry.title: Something Just Like This
entry.summary:
Author: Classical_Creep

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,047Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 191

Summary: When Superman, better known in civilian clothes as Clark Kent, helps two boys lost in Metropolis, he doesn’t expect it to lead to sharing hot chocolate with their tired, sharp-edged father. Clark has no idea the stranger is Bruce Wayne, Gotham’s reclusive billionaire ; all he sees is a tired man with storm-cloud eyes and the kind of smile he wants to see again.It should have been just a coincidence, one he’d think back on fondly, and then let go. A rainy afternoon in Metropolis, a coffee shop shelter, and two boys with sharp tongues. But by the time the storm clears, Clark’s sure of two things: He’s absolutely smitten. He has no idea how to ask for Bruce Wayne’s number in front of his kids.

entry.title: through technology
entry.summary:
Author: aobaviktor

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,280Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 55

Summary: Secure Encrypted Communications ... msg::c_from >>batcavemsg::c_to >>fortressofsolitude My appearance in Metropolis was at your request and I am thankful for what you did in return.With that understanding between us, I’d like to ask why there is an article about me in the Daily Planet?– B[Or: It's lonely being a superhero. Told entirely through private messages, news articles, voice chats, and texts.]
